urls.title: Evenlode Catchment Partnership | Wild Oxfordshire
urls.description: ‚ÄúThe tender Evenlode that makes Her meadows hush to hear the sound Of waters mingling in the brakes, And binds my heart to English ground. A lovely river, all alone, She lingers in the hills and holds A hundred little towns of stone, Forgotten in the western wolds.‚Äù ‚Äî Hilaire Bello c The Evenlode Catchment Partnership, hosted by Wild Oxfordshire, has a vision for an Evenlode with improved water quality, enhanced flood management, enriched biodiversity, with greater community engagement with rivers, at

urls.title: Flood management without concrete since 1220
urls.description: Coggeshall Abbey was founded on the banks of the river Blackwater in 1140 by King Stephen of England and Matilda of Boulogne.¬†¬†It has a long history of natural flood management.

text: @EnvAgency @LGBTHM Environment Agency approved Europe's biggest incinerator for rural Essex. Now it is ACCEPTING PAYMENT from SAME COMPANY to concrete over the River Blackwater & rip up the countryside with a 400-acre quarry. YOU ARE CORRUPT HYPOCRITES. https://t.co/3D9XjYalHC
